name: Leah Thompson
text:
It was fun for the kids. As well as myself & my teenage daughter to participate within the water slides and splash/mist zones. The water area was well structured and safe.
And, as posted, there was no lifeguard on duty. However, a person of authority and fit capabilities watched all the splash zone activities nonstop. I know she was an employee because of her uniform.
My one ouch is the end of the slides can be rough landing. For small and larger slide enthusiast.
Overall, reasonable pricing, space for belongings, very clean and fun.

name: Janna Kellum
text: The whole family had a great time!

name: Jane Velasquez
text: The jids had a great time ...

name: DL S
text: Great place to take kids to play ,let off some energy. Even adults can have fun. Family friendly place.

name: Joan Campbell
text:
Sad that it is a tiny water park.. Only has about 5 picnic tables for families.
It is more for toddlers than school age children. No a water park with anything for adults or teens.

name: Sally May A
text: Fun clean and we'll supervised

name: Misty Butler
text: Fun place to take kids

name: Deborah Bright
text: It a great place

name: Diane Key
text: Very nice

name: amy atkins
text: Fun for kids

name: Channing McGee
text: Newer splash pad facility that’s not too big, but very nice. Water activities for kids of all ages. Four good sized pavilions with picnic tables, also available to host b’day parties.  Nice bathrooms, sales of snacks/popsicles at front window where you pay admission. Cost is $3/child for 3yrs old and up.  Kids seem to love it..

name: Shaylyn Gardiner
text: Great place to cool off with the kids.

name: clayton west
text: Great summer place for the granddaughter.  Paw paws a hero when we head to the park.

name: Cynthia Pace
text: Neat shallow creek runs along side of walking trails. Craw dads, frogs, salamanders. Amazing time. Cool in the shade

text: I love the new play ground stuff they have added my grandkids had a blast

name: Amber Merrell
text: It was so fun they have so much stuff to lay on.

name: Beth Love
text: This park is great for toddlers up to age 10 to 12 . Musical toys , swings ,slides and a splash pad ! Walking trails and a small bridge  with a creek and several swings.  Very calling nice area with several covered picnic areas.

name: Dee Bberry
text: Great place for a little ones birthday party!  Play ground has been remodeled and has excellent new play things!

text: Great, clean park to take children of all ages and physical abilities.

text: This place is cool

name: grace
text: Cute park. Nice walking trail to walk your dogs on. The park is nice, and it is clean.

name: marla shirah
text: Nice little place to take the kids to play in the water plus there's a playground for those who don't want to get wet.  There's also a place to walk around the area and keep the kids in sight.

text: Awesome fun for kids nice for adults

text: A public park shouldn’t be allowed to limited to residents.

text: Very small

name: Dara Reed
text: Went to a birthday party here. The splash pad was clean and we'll kept. There were people that worked here present to enforce the rules, and make sure the pad was kept and and take out the garbage etc. Nice people. Also the had a hug pavilion with picnic tables and other shaded spots to sit. The children had a blast, and I would definitely come back again.

name: Zamora Sears
text: Hopefully they can improve more things to do but so far a happy place indeed for my kids

name: Christopher Cardone
text: Having picnic tables around just made it more perfect for the whole family

name: Lambert Cross
text: Small but just perfect for anyone that has little ones

name: Craig Mooney
text: My kids love it.small and simple but fun for them

name: Tracy Robichaud
text: This is a great place to take the kids our kids love the employees aren’t always the friendliest.

name: William Macht
text: Just perfect for the little ones to be safe and have fun

name: Smile Moore
text: I really hate how you have to be a resident of Leeds when we live just outside the city & spend money mostly in the city of Leeds supporting local businesses. I wish they would change the residential rule. I would even pay for my child to play there vs having him so excited towel in hand ....ready. To get to the gate to be denied access because we are not Leeds, Al residents.

name: Delgado Hewitt
text: What NOT to LOVE about this place.kis just enjoys this park

name: Robin Morris
text: Neat place for kid’s birthday party but a few safety issues need to be addressed, namely: 1) fasten picnic tables to concrete, one almost tipped over when folks on one side stood up, 2) paint curbs / small steps with yellow paint.

text: Good place for the kids and to have a picnic.simple is key

text: It's a municipal splash pad, and it as you would expect: crowded and a a bit dingy.  Something is usually isn't functioning, but our kids have always had fun.

name: Marc Gunn
text: Leeds only splash pad. Looked ok but couldn't use it

name: CLAMPER23
text: This place is a joke. We parked and walked forever in the heat to get to the water park. We had several small kids with us. We get there for her to put a sign up that says the pool is at capacity. Then it says 90 min limit. But when we asked if people were asked to get out at a certain time. They said no. So we just stood for a hour. No one came out. Horrible concept. Will never return. We drove 2 hours to visit. We called and called before to get details but no answer.

name: Linda Stringfellow
text: This place is great for parties!  Our group usually rents the pool at least once a year.  It's clean, well taken care of, with something for all ages.  And the lifeguards are always so nice.

name: K O
text: Love this place but drove there to find out they aren't open yet, though everything online said they were.  Finally dug down the web enough to figure out the open season hadnt started yet.

name: Lyric Chastain
text: Pretty cool I guess

name: Amanda Williams
text: Excellent play for families & kids of all ages. So much fun!!

name: Erick Kent
text: Nice pool and water slide. Multiple lifeguards. Enjoyed it.

name: Krystle Hawkins
text: Best place for small kids. We had so much fun!

name: Jennifer Wilson
text: So much fun! My kids love the shallow splashpad area and its shallow enough I feel safe letting them free to enjoy themselves while i sit on the side watching and catching some rays...esp thanks to the number lifeguards on duty at all times watching out too. The slide brings a lot of laughs as well. Great time

name: Ashley Vaughn
text: It's best place to go

name: Tonya “Funny A Mama” Knight
text: Awesome place to cool off !

name: Gerald Carpenter
text: It's nice swimming pool

name: Jerry Amos
text:
A hidden treasure. Clean, affordable family fun. Lifeguards on duty and a snack bar. Will more than like frequently visit this facility.
If there is a downside, it would be the odor in the restrooms. Also, several of the doors to the restroom stalls fail to secure/lock or are broken.
Overall,  a great destination.

name: Heather Alvarado
text: So fun! My son is a water bug & their kiddie area is perfect for him + the slide!

name: Angie Frost
text: One of the very best public pools around! The life guards r very, very, alert! Everyone is so sweet! They do not tolerate bullying! My grandkids Breauna, Miguel and myself totally enjoy it!

name: Dawn Payne
text: Very friendly family oriented swimming pool.

name: Tim Mcmichael
text: Great place to bring the family to cool off. Clean facility,  very large pool with diving board and slide.

name: Britney Messer
text: *ATTENTION PARENTS* If you bring small children they need a little swimmer!! We spent only 15 minutes here before having to leave because a child pooped in the pool! It's a very nice water park as long as PARENTS follow the rules!

name: Gin fHarrelson
text: We love swimming here, but the bathroom stall doors and dressing room doors will not close. Food/drinks are a little pricey.

name: Art Of Valor
text: Love this place!! Also love the fact that there is always a lifeguard on duty. Very safe environment for children and lots of fun!!

name: Makayla Zillig
text: Its a great place to swim it has an awesome waterslide and diving board and the swimpad is fun too but the lifeguards will get onto you if you are on the diving board for to long or you and a friend go down the slide together but my older sister got pulled under in the 12 foot and shes doesnt know how to swim she was hanging onto the edge talking to friends while i was on the diving board when someine grabbed her and she couldnt breathe if it hadnt been for my stepdad literly throwing her out of the pool she would have drowned and the lifeguard didnt even take notice or care

name: Carolyn Kemp
text: I love to go there by my self go give me   only. Me time to relax and lay in the sun meet new friends trying to get myself from being so depressed

name: Ryan Cobb
text: Really enjoyed the driving range. Nothing fancy but everything you need at a good price and a private setting.

name: brandy andrews
text: Only open 2 hours, no chairs out, sitting on concrete, not what I paid for

name: morgan
text: It's fine! Ice Cream available. 1 foot deep up to 12 feet deep. Available: Food and drinks, slide, diving board, kids area, bathrooms, outside clothes-on shower, baby area. Family freindly. Water: chemicals, clear, DO NOT TASTE, TASTES LIKE PICKLE-PEE, crowded. Kids: rude, loud, will grab on to your leg, steals floats, stays in baby area. Thanks for reading!

name: Ernest Thurston
text: Summer fun in the pool. Several ball fields, picnic pavilions and table. Spring fed creek runs through the park with nature trail alongside. A short walk to get onto Ladiga trail.

name: angela brogdon
text: This was my first and last time going here. First there were flies everywhere so many it felt like I was in a toilet that hadn't been flushed for a month and I fell like the price was to high for as small as it was. The only thing it really had going for itself was it has the only diving board and slide around but not worth $6 if u ask me

name: Nico Wright
text: It was amazing had a lot of fun with the kids if u haven't been u should go nice n clean

name: Brian Millican
text:
It's hard to believe this gem is tucked away in Piedmont, AL. We took my daughter (3 years old) and a nephew (11 years old). They both loved it. You just can't beat it for $5/each.
Note: There are only two lifeguards on duty, so please make sure you monitor your kids at all times!

name: angela brogdon
text: This was my first and last time going here. First there were flies everywhere so many it felt like I was in a toilet that hadn't been flushed for a month and I fell like the price was to high for as small as it was. The only thing it really had going for itself was it has the only diving board and slide around but not worth $6 if u ask me

text: Great place, pools are good and a nice atmosphere. Really fun for parents and kids.
